teaching.topicContent: Introduce the concept of identifying and discriminating ending sounds in words. Engage students with activities that involve listening to words and identifying their final sounds, helping them recognize and distinguish between various ending sounds.

Explain that sentences can be broken into words and words into syllables. Teach students about the concept of syllables and how to identify the position of sounds within words. Use engaging exercises to practice syllable segmentation and sound position awareness.

Explore the relationship between words and sentences. Help students understand how words work together to form sentences, and how changing words can alter the meaning of a sentence. Engage in sentence-building activities to reinforce comprehension of word usage in context.

Introduce the skill of blending two phonemes together to form words. Guide students through activities where they listen to isolated phonemes and blend them to create simple words. Gradually increase the complexity of the phoneme blends as their proficiency improves.

Explore compound words and their components. Teach students how to break down compound words into their individual parts and recognize their meanings. Engage in interactive exercises that involve identifying and segmenting compound words to enhance vocabulary and comprehension.

Extend phonemic awareness by focusing on segmenting three phonemes within words. Guide students through activities that require them to isolate and identify individual phonemes in various words. Practice segmenting skills with words of increasing complexity to strengthen their phonemic manipulation abilities.

test.description: Put your Phonics and letter sound knowledge to the test.
